response.answer_text: I’ve been making money on the internet full time for the last 6 years, I’d be happy to help. It took a few years to figure out what works and what was a scam. IMPORTANT: I now focus on just 3 online business models, and make over $1M per year… (Crazy what happens when you focus on what works). Before getting to the answer, it’s really important to understand the following: Making money online keeps us truthful, the numbers will never lie. If you put in the work, you will make money, if you don't put in the work, you won't make money. The amount you make is in relation to the amount of work you’re willing to put in. I’ll show you 10 ways that I currently make money online (all within the 3 online business models), that you can start without spending money. Also, I’ll show you 10 ways that I do not recommend for making money online. You don’t need to buy any courses, or have any specific skills to get started. Additionally, you don't need to sell anyone anything! With that said, I’ll list the categories below, then I’ll attach a video to explain the categories broken down into 10 specific websites. Categories Print On-Demand: Creating simple, catchy, funny, or even text only, designs that are uploaded to websites that offer that design to be printed on clothing items and accessories. You create the designs (with design apps) and upload them to the big print on-demand websites, then they create virtual listings of your ‘products’, and market them for you. Then when someone order an item, the website prints the item with the design on it, ships it to the customer, and handles all customer service. They take a split of the profit, and you get the rest. [How To Video] Affiliate Marketing: Creating reviews, comparisons, articles, about products or services, then linking the reader/viewer to the product where they can purchase it, and the company who sells the product will give you a commission for referring the person. [How To Video] Information Products: Creating online courses, or ebooks, to share your knowledge on a specific topic, and selling it digitally around the world. You only have to create the online course, or ebook, one time and you can sell it time-and-time again digitally. Rather than writing a novel for you, here’s a video to explain 10 best websites you can use to start making money online, without spending money.  Additionally, here’s a similar video with the 10 ways that I do not recommend for making money online:

Don’t whether it is possible to earn cash online. Certainly, you can earn money that is deposited into a bank account that you can use later on. There are lots of ways to make money online. Just find the sweet spot where ALL of the following six criteria intersects: You are so passionate about the money making idea that you will spend ALL your free time working on it (even on weekends!).You want to create value for people and desire to make a difference in their lives.You have willing or desperate customers wanting to pay you for your work because you can solve their pain points or problems.You can create a sustainable living out of that money making idea when you do decide to quit your 9-to-5 job – Remember always that you have to pay your bills!You have the relevant skills and experience to perform the side gig without much re-skilling or learning.You want to align yourself with your religious beliefs. Here’s a seven-step process to explore some suitable business ideas, selecting that one idea that potentially sells, and making that idea work for you. Step 1 – You brainstorm and select your proposed business idea.Step 2 – Develop an overall strategy for making money. This step requires you to determine your money making criteria and meeting those criteria. You will need to update your strategy as you gather more information. Remember that people don’t plan to fail, they fail to plan.Step 3 – Acquire or develop a product (e.g., e-Books, tools, coaching services, training, etc) that will help solve your target customers’ problem. The aim is to sell a relevant product to your customers and make money. Test out your proposed product by converting it into a minimum viable product.Step 4 – Identify the best platforms and established marketplaces (e.g., eBay, Facebook, blogs, etc.) where the majority of your target customers hang out so that you can sell them your proposed product.Step 5 – Validate your minimum viable product with your customers using these established marketplaces.Step 6 – Work hard to market and drive Internet traffic to your chosen platforms so that you can convert your visitors into leads and thereafter transforming them into paying customers.Step 7 – Depending on your testing results, you could scale-up selling this product with your own website, find another new product to sell, or ditch the product altogether.There are no get rich quick schemes to follow. There is no button to press and money comes pouring in. Everything requires significant effort and perseverance. Just do it and never give up! It takes hard work to earn money. . I’ve been making money online since 2005. It’s been over 15 years. I quit my full-time job 2 years ago to become a full-time blogger. Right now, I’m making a living from online i.e from my blog. You can read my blog’s journey to find all the details. Here’s a screenshot of earnings from an affiliate product I promote on my log (which generated over $240,000 in affiliate commissions).  At an average, I earn around $10K from my blog. So yea, my answer to your question on how to earn money online is this: start a blog. Starting a blog has its own benefits including; Helps you generate incomeHelps you build a brandHelps you network with other bloggers and influencersImproves your marketing skillsImproves your writing skills (if you’re the one who’s going to create content for your blog)And the list goes onAnd.. the best part is, it doesn’t cost you much. In fact, you can start your own professional blog on platforms like WordPress for just under $100/year budget. Yes, you heard it right. All you need to start a professional blog is a domain and web hosting. If you’re just getting started, web hosts like Bluehost will be more than enough. It also offers you a free domain for the first year. You can set up your own blog on Bluehost within 10 to 15 minutes. Here are a few important tips that helped me build a profitable blog. If you’re planning to start a new blog, use these tips as they can help you a lot. Focus on one topic: Most beginners make a mistake by covering too many topics. It’s not the right way. Focus on one topic. Cover in-depth content around that one particular topic. Get more traffic and build an audience around that one topic. Then, move on to the next topic. That’s how you grow a new blog!Don’t copy others: Another biggest mistake: stop stealing content from others. Also, don’t replicate other’s blog design, content etc. You should be unique. That’s how you build a great blog from day 1.Learn how to sell: Profitable blogging is all about selling. Don’t sound like a sales guy in the market. You should learn how to sell by educating your target audience. Find out a monetization strategy such as affiliate marketing, selling your own products, offering services etc to generate income from your blog.Invest money: Yes, you can start a blog for free. But free blogging platforms have limitations. If you’re planning to start a blog to make money, learn to invest. Invest in proper hosting, domain, essential tools etc as they are all going to help you build a successful blog quickly.So there you go. Have any questions? Let me know in the comments. If you find this answer helpful, please upvote. To your success, Anil Agarwal

There are many different businesses that you can focus on and we will look at what you should look for within a particular business that you want to do. There are great many opportunities for you in creating a work at home business that focus on the Internet and online. Affiliate marketing is the most common. Some of the categories that you can market include finance and investment, food and beverage, automotive, and health and fitness. Each affiliate program will list their website as well as a small description on what they do and you will want to visit the website as well. If you are going to be spending a great deal of your time promoting a particular website and program, you'll want to make sure that this is worth your while. Also, with each of these particular programs, you should look at how much money you would be making by selling each of these. You'll probably find several programs that seem interesting to you so see which one peaks your interest and pays well and head for that opportunity. For me I have been using Cickbank, Ebay, and Amazon although I have preciously used Maxbounty, Ogads which are still great options. As far as fair warning for what seems to be opportunities on the Web for other things, there are many different websites that promise that you can make money through either taking surveys or through posting on free forums for several hours day. This sounded good and many people have signed up and found that they have wasted a great deal of time and money in the end when trying out these so-called “opportunities”. Remember to listen to your gut when you're thinking about this. There are many work-at-home scams out there so make sure to take your time in reading about what the different websites have to offer. Another great work home business that has an online focus can be eBay. This is stressed throughout some articles on this website but it is a great tool for you to begin your career. You can learn how to write sales copy for your auctions as well as how to properly promote yourself. If you take the lessons to be learned on eBay and apply them to other Internet marketing areas, you will find yourself ready to tackle almost anything out there. This is just is not all that is out there but it all depends at what skills you have and what you are able to do well. You can contact me anytime for consultation through Skype (check bio for email)

Making money on the web has become a routine activity. Just two decades ago, when the internet was considered a luxury, nobody could believe that it would be so easy to earn from home, using just a computer. Today, I want to present to you a shortlist of the trendiest directions that can help make money on the internet: start a blog;write books;start a YouTube channel;become an online translator;enrol in affiliate advertising;start selling online;create an online casino;use your voice;take online surveys.Start a Blog Blogging is a good way to make a quick profit. Starting your blog is easy. There are many free platforms for this. Your life definitely has something interesting to talk about. Even if you do not visit different countries every month, but simply lead a peaceful life, there is always something that may be of interest to other people. Are you creative? Show off your work, immerse your readers in this topic, and tell stories about how you do it and what inspires you. Do you walk a lot? Take photos of your favourite places, city attractions or just tell others what is best to visit in your city. Eventually, profit will come from sponsored articles or goods that you will show in your photos. As easy as that! Write Books  Nowadays, everyone lives on the Internet, spending time chatting, searching for information, or simply reading books online. Online authorship, as a form of making money, does not require any investment. If you have an interesting story and want to tell it to others, feel free to start writing. And you can place your creations on such platforms as Apple's App Store, Google Play Store, or Amazon's Kindle. First, you can give away your books for free or ask for a minimal price. As you gather a wider audience, you can increase the cost of your books. Start a YouTube channel This is a very profitable business. Create entertaining videos, make up animated clips, or run a travel blog. Share your videos on the channel, get views, and, of course, profit. All it takes is a quality camera and a good idea. By uploading a video to YouTube, you should immediately monetize it. When users watch the video, YouTube will advertise and share with you a portion of its income. The amount depends on the number of views and subscribers on your channel. For example, a channel with a million users brings its owner from 100 to 300 thousand dollars a month! Success depends only on how interested people are in your content and editing skills. Become an Online Translator For people who know two or more foreign languages, there is always the possibility of additional income. Several freelance platforms can easily help you find a job. In most cases, these sites work like auctions, where each translator offers their prices, and the customer chooses which option suits him. The customer and the translator solve their money issues through the platform. The more exotic the language is, the higher the price can be (but the demand can be lower). Affiliate Advertising  If you have your own portal or informational resource, you can earn additional income from advertising your partners by actively promoting their product on your website. In this case, you will receive money only when your visitors follow the backlinks from your website. Affiliate marketing is pretty diverse since you can agree on different types of cooperation (you can get paid for clicks or clients’ actions). Sell Online Hand-made things are getting more and more popular. If you know how to make jewellery, knit, or make stuffed toys, this is a good way to make money. Thanks to such social networks as Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram, you can easily find your target audience. Create an Online Casino No jokes, you can become an owner of your own online gambling establishment. And there is no need to invest millions. Even though a personal casino from scratch costs around $150,000, you can always work towards a franchise or a White label business. The organizational process takes just a few weeks and there is no problem with the legality. Use Your Voice Do you have a pleasant gentle timbre, or, on the contrary, a courageous baritone? Then you have a great opportunity to sell your voice. There are many Internet services for this. All you need for this is a good equipment to make high-quality audio recordings. You basically choose a task, complete it, and receive your money. What could be easier? Also, you can work on yourself and create podcasts with sponsored mentions of their items and services. You just want to ensure that the public loves your voice. Take Online Surveys  Quite recently, it was hard to imagine that you can earn extra money by answering the questions on the internet. They pay a little here, but you can always make yourself a certain amount. However, be ready to get paid with vouchers from popular online stores. As you can see, there are tons of ways to make money from home using the internet. The only thing that you need is determination. Pick a direction that you enjoy and work towards receiving profit from it. This is what happened in my case. I decided to turn my gambling hobby into a simple project. A few years later, I am a successful owner of a few huge online gambling establishments. By the way, Online Casino Market and their convenient turnkey casino solution played a great role in this story. Have a beautiful day!

Arguably, the internet is the greatest invention by mankind since the stone age. Let’s recall some history: Agrarian Age The agrarian age was a period in history when the economy was primarily based on production and maintenance of agricultural crops and farmland. Also known as the natural economy because of its overreliance on natural resources, the agrarian society had other means of livelihood and work habits but mostly stressed the importance of agriculture and farming as the primary source of income and the use of basic tools. As such, the agrarian society emphasized the ownership of land, shelter and agricultural produce as the primary source of wealth. The Industrial Age By design, the industrial age was rooted on industrial design was developed based on mass-manufacturing. As such, machines replaced most of the processes that were traditionally done by humans. The industrial society emphasized importance of land, manufacturing and other physical possessions as the primary source of wealth. The Knowledge Age Since at least 1959, management guru, Peter Drucker first described the rise of “knowledge work” in his book, Landmarks of Tomorrow. Decades later, Drucker was more convinced that knowledge was a more crucial economic resource than land, labor, or financial assets, leading to what he called a “post-capitalist society.” In 2001, Peter Drucker declared as follows: “The next society will be a knowledge society. Knowledge will be its key resource, and knowledge workers will be the dominant group in its workforce. Its three main characteristics will be: Borderlessness, because knowledge travels even more effortlessly than money.Upward mobility, available to everyone through easily acquired formal education.The potential for failure as well as success. Anyone can acquire the “means of production”, ie, the knowledge required for the job, but not everyone can win.Together, those three characteristics will make the knowledge society a highly competitive one, for organizations and individuals alike. Information technology, although only one of many new features of the next society, is already having one hugely important effect: it is allowing knowledge to spread near-instantly, and making it accessible to everyone. Given the ease and speed at which information travels, every institution in the knowledge society — not only businesses, but also schools, universities, hospitals and increasingly government agencies too — has to be globally competitive, even though most organizations will continue to be local in their activities and in their markets. This is because the Internet will keep customers everywhere informed on what is available anywhere in the world, and at what price[1] . Enough with Drucker’s predictions. Let’s get back to the question: “How do I earn money from home using the internet?” The Internet The internet emphasizes the importance of information, knowledge and data as the primary source of wealth. Therefore, to make money on the internet, you must find a way to sell information, knowledge or data. 95% of the world’s economy is still offline. As such, most of the information, knowledge or data is used for purposes of feeding the offline economy. For example, suppose someone wants to find the cheapest air line from New York to Singapore. You won’t believe it, but finding such information can be quite daunting, even intimidating for some people. But suppose you build a website for people to easily access such information. You can even make it easier by organizing the data by airline, by air fare and other features. The traveler will be able to find the data she’s looking for quite easily. She’ll even be able to customize the data, sort it according to any criteria she likes. Now, suppose you charge a small fee for the entire service. No big deal. However, online services have gone ahead and not only prepared such data for potential customers to consume, but also gone further and provided a ton of other value-added services to remain competitive because the competition for such services is very high. The best route to do this is to take your current job or job that you are very good at and convert that into working from home. I’ve successfully done this TWICE: I was a computer technician based in Atlanta where my employer and my customer were located. These were larger servers, not PC’s, in which most of the work was able to be done through connecting to the systems through local or remote networks. I was making up to just under $80K up until about 2010 doing this. The way I converted this job from an on-site job to a telecommuting job was unique for the situation. My wife’s job caused us to relocate from Atlanta to Chicago. We were a few people short in my department due to illness. So my boss suggested I could “dial in” (back when we still had dial-up lines to the systems) and work from home until I could find a new job in Chicago as he still needed my help in Atlanta. But after about six months of working from home, my boss said, “Why not just continue working from home? You’re doing just as much telecommuting as you would be onsite…”. So I worked from home for the next ten years.Currently I’m a real estate agent, but I work in a referral service for my company at the company headquarters. Typically I’d have to work in an office about 50 miles away, driving one way. After a series of terrible snowstorms, several instances of having to cover co-workers who couldn’t make it into the office, and showing managers that I could do everything from home, I was able to permanently work from home from that point on. I offered to be able to cover evening shifts with no extra fuss and do things a lot easier than I would have to do if I had to drive in. I still come into the office once every few months for major meetings, but for the most part, it’s all working from home. I had one snag trying to get a VOIP phone to work correctly for the job I do, but when that got resolved, I can do everything I could do back in the office.So really, if you want to work from home, do what you do best and/or do what you love and you can transform the job into a “work from home” job.

Here are some of the options you could explore: - Freelancing - If you have a marketable and in-demand professional skill, you could list yourself on platforms like Upwork, Freelancer or Crossover and start earning. Areas of expertise range from data entry to complex technical projects as well. You could find mostly each marketable skill listed on these platforms with a project that needs a freelancer. - Search and Social Media Engine Evaluations - Checkout opportunities that Appen offers as an Internet researcher and evaluator for Google, Microsoft and Facebook. However, there is no guarantee of steady work and pay may not be enough for you to support all of your expenses. Still, learning is good. - Social Media Marketing - If you own a social media profile with really good followership and audience engagement, you can approach brands and help them tap into their target market through social media marketing. Payments can flow in for each post, social media banners or events. - Blogging - If you own a blog or website with good traffic, you can check out the Google Adsense program to earn money as well. - Influencer marketing - If you are an expert in any fields like technology, arts, education or entertainment, you can start your youtube channel, grow it and start earning through brand recommendations, reviews as well as by enabling your channel for monetization through youtube. -Affiliate marketing - Many retail websites as well as business brands allow bloggers and social media marketers to promote their products through an affiliate link. When your followers or visitors click those links and buy something from the brand, you get paid a fixed commission.- Stock market trading - With some capital and knowledge of the stock market, you can sign up with a broking firm and start trading in stocks to earn money as well. All of these options aside, you must first decide what is your expertise and there is enough material available online for you to learn how to grow each of these businesses. Just remember not to fall prey for scams and verify the credibility of platforms and people through online research beforehand. None of the above options except stock market trading I suggested, should cost a dime to get started.
